definition: divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)

sentences.english: This text adopt old view also, think Divination of Confucian originate from Yan Zou spread out period.
sentences.chinese: 本文還採用了陳槃的觀點，認爲讖緯起源於鄒衍時期。

sentences.english: Prophetic Theology is a flow of distinctive social trend of thought in the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 讖緯是兩漢時期獨特的社會思潮。

definition: Western Jin dynasty 西晋 historian, author of History of the Three Kingdoms 三國志|三国志
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
the Hundred Schools of Thought, the various schools of thought and their exponents during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (770-220 BC)

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
Chinese phonetics (concerned also with rhyme in poetry)
Classic of Rites (same as 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4])
Rizhilu or Record of daily study, by early Confucian philosopher Gu Yanwu 顧炎武|顾炎武
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
